greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of length 2n words such that all letters of the k-ary alphabet occur at least once and are introduced in ascending order and which can be built by repeatedly inserting doublets into the initially empty word; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: In general, column k>2 is asymptotic to (4*(k-1))^n / ((k-2)^2 * (k-2)! * sqrt(Pi) * n^(3/2)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 01 2015
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
example: T(3,2) = 9: aaaabb, aaabba, aabaab, aabbaa, aabbbb, abaaba, abbaaa, abbabb, abbbba.
T(3,3) = 5: aabbcc, aabccb, abbacc, abbcca, abccba.
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, k/n*
mathematica: Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 22 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_, updated Jan 01 2021 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 15 2015
